Articles.Content:
Quick Update

Javascript is disabled. View full album

-Work continues

-Landing gear got super complicated, but it's all done!

-All animations done.

-3D mesh of exterior is about 80% complete.

-All features finalized. No more additions, so please don't message me with suggestions.

Features

-Mundoor. That's the doors you see just behind the cockpit.

-Cargo Bay space 10% longer than previous pictures (the cargo bay was lengthened).

-Larger V-tail stabilizers. RCS built into the blocks in the rear.

-Kerbals sit high, cockpit panel is low and thin, think SST cab to get a rough idea.

-2 Kerbals on flight deck

-6 Kerbals on crew deck

-Cockpit is all digital and fully integrated. Will not have as many RPM MFDs as the KSO.

-FMC will be functional and will run RPM as you're used to from the KSO.

-Two center MFDs will not run RPM. They will instead be the aircraft's EIFAS and EICAS.
Its exactly how I thought it would look
That stubby nose is sooo sexy. Looks great helldiver!

Each part on the bottom of the shuttle has some ablative shielding to it. Thing is that they all have an even 250, despite not heating evenly during reentry. The engine mount and nose gear are prime examples of this: The engine mount and cargo bay can come down with nearly all of their shielding intact, while the nose gear can overheat and explode if you don't keep the nose high enough while coming in.

It's not that hard to do, but the process is a tad tedious and long.

I forgot about the ablative shielding. I changed mine over to non-ablative, reflective only.
That new model looks great. I just hope it won't be too complicated to get FAR working with extra features on the wings.

I won't lie. After a file corruption, I had neither the time or patience to recapture this behemoth, so hyperedit was utilized.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited April 11, 2014 by sharpspoonful
grammer'd!

Quick Update

http://imgur.com/a/mKnkJ

-Work continues

-Landing gear got super complicated, but it's all done!

-All animations done.

-3D mesh of exterior is about 80% complete.

-All features finalized. No more additions, so please don't message me with suggestions.

Features

-Mundoor. That's the doors you see just behind the cockpit.

-Cargo Bay space 10% longer than previous pictures (the cargo bay was lengthened).

-Larger V-tail stabilizers. RCS built into the blocks in the rear.

-Kerbals sit high, cockpit panel is low and thin, think SST cab to get a rough idea.

-2 Kerbals on flight deck

-6 Kerbals on crew deck

-Cockpit is all digital and fully integrated. Will not have as many RPM MFDs as the KSO.

-FMC will be functional and will run RPM as you're used to from the KSO.

-Two center MFDs will not run RPM. They will instead be the aircraft's EIFAS and EICAS.

Looks great, man.
So I can pretend the Resolute was the only shuttle equipped with ablative shielding and all the other shuttles had other types to reduce costs or something. Sweet!
Off-the-wall question that just popped into my head: We've got Adamant, Dauntless, Resolute, and Tenacious as the standard KSOs, so what will the names of the Super-25 orbiters be?

Off-the-wall question that just popped into my head: We've got Adamant, Dauntless, Resolute, and Tenacious as the standard KSOs, so what will the names of the Super-25 orbiters be?

I know helldiver's going to tell us off for trying to decide this for him.... But I would love one to be called "Enterprise" as it makes nods to so many references, and I feel suits the shuttle

EDIT: Or "endeavour"... But I know the names that are coming will be awesome

Edited April 11, 2014 by GentleHeaven
Well if we're throwing out suggestions I was going to say "Defiant" to go along with the other names, but like you said, whatever Helldiver picks will be just fine.

Helldiver, that is one good-looking shuttle. I'm glad you're going with the bogie main gear, it really helps establish the Super 25 as larger and chunkier than the regular KSO.

Looking forward to flying it!
How large will the super 25 update be?
What font/typeface do the "stock" shuttle names use? I want to make a custom named one that tries to match the other shuttles style through gimp.
Because the super 25 is, well, the super 2.5 metre cargo bay, I'm probably going to figure out a way to refit it with nuke engines and call it Voyager.

I know helldiver's going to tell us off for trying to decide this for him.... But I would love one to be called "Enterprise" as it makes nods to so many references, and I feel suits the shuttle

EDIT: Or "endeavour"... But I know the names that are coming will be awesome

I really hope they name one Endeavour. That was my favourite of the shuttle fleet simply because it brought up the Canadarm2, and was the shuttle that allowed the fist Canadian spacewalk conducted by none other than Chris Hadfield.
looks absolutely amazing. I use a single vertical stabilizer on the existing KSO, are you going to keep the stabilizers customizable?

looks absolutely amazing. I use a single vertical stabilizer on the existing KSO, are you going to keep the stabilizers customizable?

-Not the Super 25. Unless you turn off its RCS and provide your own RCS solution. Placing the v-tail into a single vertical configuration (NASA Shuttle/Buran style) will screw up the RCS and will cause it to spin out of control.

I really hope they name one Endeavour. That was my favourite of the shuttle fleet simply because it brought up the Canadarm2, and was the shuttle that allowed the fist Canadian spacewalk conducted by none other than Chris Hadfield.

-No real names allowed. To be honest, I hadn't planned on even putting a name on the side.
So will there not be RCS on the rear fuselage, provided entirely by the tail pieces? Or are the tail pieces in addition to the fuselage RCS ports?

-Not the Super 25. Unless you turn off its RCS and provide your own RCS solution. Placing the v-tail into a single vertical configuration (NASA Shuttle/Buran style) will screw up the RCS and will cause it to spin out of control.

-No real names allowed. To be honest, I hadn't planned on even putting a name on the side.

Can you give us the what font you used for Resolute? I want to put Endeavour on the side of my KSO Super 25.

-Not the Super 25. Unless you turn off its RCS and provide your own RCS solution. Placing the v-tail into a single vertical configuration (NASA Shuttle/Buran style) will screw up the RCS and will cause it to spin out of control.

-No real names allowed. To be honest, I hadn't planned on even putting a name on the side.

If you are allowing people to request names, the only fitting name I can think of is The Helldiver. (See what I did there)

I'ts fitting.
How about the Flying Bucket as a name for the super 25?

-Not the Super 25. Unless you turn off its RCS and provide your own RCS solution. Placing the v-tail into a single vertical configuration (NASA Shuttle/Buran style) will screw up the RCS and will cause it to spin out of control.

Looks like I'll be adding RCS then. It was the tail placement and angle that made the difference with FAR. But that's a small price to pay for a nice craft like this.
The real space shuttle used the helvetica font. This is what I used on mine
For some reason, KSOS crashes the game is there any file im supposed to replace to make it work in 23.5?
